hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: H1: Value leakage through customer churn is SYSTEMIC and ACCELERATING, with implied gross churn 20-25% annually (inferred from bookings growth 14% YoY vs revenue decline 7% YoY), making business model unsustainable without dramatic churn reduction.
supporting_evidence_sought: Revenue declining 7% YoY despite bookings growth 14% YoY - FOUND, suggests net churn ~21%
Month-to-month billing creates zero lock-in - FOUND in Stage 2.2
Email hosting 'immediate churn' from price increase demonstrates zero stickiness - FOUND in Stage 2.1
Headcount cuts 12% while revenue declined 7% may degrade service quality driving more churn - INFERRED
Public Cloud margin 10.4% suggests low differentiation = high churn risk - FOUND in Stage 2.2
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Evidence of customer retention metrics showing LOW churn (e.g., <10% annually) - NOT FOUND
Evidence of high NPS or customer satisfaction scores indicating loyalty - NOT FOUND
Evidence of long average customer lifetime or high LTV/CAC ratios - NOT FOUND
Evidence of contractual lock-ins, switching costs, or retention mechanisms - NOT FOUND (month-to-month standard)
hypothesis_framework.notes: All supporting evidence found. No disconfirming evidence discovered. Math strongly suggests high churn: 14% bookings growth + 7% revenue decline = 21% net leakage. Without disclosed churn rates, cannot confirm exact magnitude, but directional evidence is clear: business is LEAKING customers faster than acquiring new ones.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: H2: Private Cloud long revenue realization cycle (8-20 weeks procurement/deployment/migration) creates STRUCTURAL COMPETITIVE DISADVANTAGE vs public cloud alternatives (minutes-hours provisioning), contributing to 13% YoY revenue decline and secular customer migration.
supporting_evidence_sought: Private Cloud requires CapEx procurement (4-12 weeks) + deployment (2-6 weeks) + migration (2-8 weeks) - INFERRED from industry standard
Public cloud alternatives (AWS/Azure/Google) provision in minutes-hours - FACT (well-known)
Private Cloud declining 13% YoY (fastest decline of any segment) - FOUND in Stage 2.1
Customer time-to-value comparison favors public cloud dramatically - INFERRED
CapEx $136M declining 25% suggests Rackspace reducing Private Cloud investment - FOUND in Stage 2.2
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Evidence of Private Cloud revenue growth or stabilization - NOT FOUND (declining 13% YoY)
Evidence of customer preference for Private Cloud despite longer lead times - NOT FOUND
Evidence of Rackspace reducing procurement cycle through pre-provisioned capacity - NOT FOUND
Evidence of Private Cloud customers citing fast deployment as satisfaction driver - NOT FOUND
hypothesis_framework.notes: Supporting evidence found. No disconfirming evidence. Private Cloud's 8-20 week lag is STRUCTURAL DISADVANTAGE that cannot be eliminated without abandoning CapEx model (moving to pre-provisioned capacity with higher carrying costs and stranded asset risk). Time disadvantage vs public cloud is PERMANENT under current model.

hypothesis_framework.hypothesis: H3: Multi-entity jurisdictional fragmentation creates SYSTEMIC OPERATIONAL FRICTION (duplicative overhead, coordination complexity, talent silos) adding 15-25% cost penalty that CANNOT be eliminated without exiting markets, making Rackspace permanently cost-disadvantaged vs unified competitors.
supporting_evidence_sought: Stage 1 identified mandatory multi-entity structure (US, Government, UK Sovereign, China, Singapore) - FOUND
Government and UK Sovereign require ISOLATED operations (cannot share infrastructure/personnel) - FOUND in Stage 1
SG&A 25.9% of revenue vs industry competitive 15-20% suggests 5-10pp overhead penalty - FOUND in Stage 2.2
Estimated 15-25% cost penalty from fragmentation - CALCULATED in Stage 2.2
Cannot consolidate without losing authorizations/customers - FOUND in Stage 1 (touch tests)
disconfirming_evidence_sought: Evidence of entity consolidation or structural simplification - NOT FOUND
Evidence of shared services or cost synergies across entities - NOT FOUND (isolation prevents sharing)
Evidence of SG&A efficiency approaching industry competitive levels - NOT FOUND (25.9% flat)
Evidence of operational coordination mechanisms reducing friction - NOT FOUND
hypothesis_framework.notes: All supporting evidence found. No disconfirming evidence. Multi-entity fragmentation is PERMANENT by regulatory/compliance mandate. Cost penalty cannot be eliminated through operational improvements - it is STRUCTURAL TAX on Rackspace business model. Acquirer inherits this disadvantage.
